body.p: Furthermore, the Board clarified that the disclosure in paragraph 24J(b) of IFRS 7 does not require disclosure of financial instruments that are referenced to an interest rate benchmark subject to the reform at the reporting date, but which will expire prior to transitioning to an alternative benchmark rate. This is because, to meet the objective of this disclosure requirement (see paragraph BC35III), an entity is required to provide information about financial instruments that would be required to transition to alternative benchmark rates (ie before their maturity).
